item.title: UFO sightings in India
item.description:

This article catalogs reported UFO sightings in India, spanning from 1951 to 2023. Each entry includes the date, location, and a brief description of the event, often with links to news sources or related articles.

1951 ðŸ”—

This section details a report from New Delhi where members of a flying club observed a cigar-shaped object, estimated to be around one hundred feet long, in the sky. The source cited is NICAP (National Investigations Committee On Aerial Phenomena).

2004 ðŸ”—

This section recounts an incident on September 27, 2004, where scientists in Samudra Tapu (Chandra Taal) spotted a white, “snowman”-like object on a nearby mountain ridge. India Today speculated it could have been a spy drone or balloon.

2007 ðŸ”—

This section mentions a “fireball” photographed in the skies of Kolkata in October, which was claimed to be shape-shifting.

2013 ðŸ”—

This section lists two separate incidents. The first involves residents of Chennai observing five specks of bright orange light in the night sky in June. The second details how troops of the Indian Army spotted several UFOs near the Ladakh border in August.

2015 ðŸ”—

This section describes two separate incidents in Uttar Pradesh. In Gorakhpur, a resident claimed to have photographed a large UFO, but the photo was suspected to be digitally altered. In Kanpur, a boy reportedly captured a flying saucer in a photo of clouds taken with his father’s phone.

2023 ðŸ”—

This section details a recent event in November where a UFO was spotted over Imphal airport, causing a three-hour disruption to flight services. Two Indian Air Force Rafale fighter jets were scrambled, but the search was unsuccessful.
